story.title: My Confidant - Episode 4
story.storyDescription: When Lucy hears a stranger break into her apartment, she texts her long-distance boyfriend, Brendan. Too bad there’s nothing he can do to save her…
story.creator: web-uploader

messages.text: Please, Luce, please stay on the phone with me
See how I’m begging? Does that make you happy?
Sorry, that was mean
But, it’s just, I’m going crazy worrying if you’re all right
Luce, don’t do this to me.
Fuck!
Sorry for cursing
Wait. Did Topher put you up to this? Ignoring me?
2 minutes later
What am I talking about? Topher is dead.
Brendan, breathe
I’m here and alive
But yes, Topher is dead
Lucy—holy shit
I’m so nervous I just threw up
Oh, Brendan ☹
I know how you feel--my stomach is tying itself in knots
Please let me keep texting you
Brendan, I love you
But we talked about this--I need to concentrate on my surroundings
And I think it’s dangerous if my phone keeps lighting up
Yeah, I guess you’re right
But try to text me in 30 minutes, okay?
Just so I’ll know what you’re doing
So I’ll know that you’re all right.
Okay.
Lucy clicks on the text message conversation between her and Topher.
Okay, I talked to Brendan
He was acting really weird when I didn’t answer him
Like super possessive and aggressive.
See?!
I told you he’s evil.
That doesn’t mean he’s evil.
But I’m telling you he is
Lucy, this whole situation is freaking me out.
Seriously--my heart is pounding. I can’t breathe.
I feel like someone’s gonna come after me at any minute.
OMG, me too.
It’s so creepy and empty in this cell.
NO--LUCY!
Listen.
I KILLED someone tonight.
WHAT?! Shit--Topher!
You killed someone tonight and you’re seriously expecting me to believe YOU right now?!
Ugh, please. You think I’m happy about it? It was in self-defense
I needed to kill him to get out of my cell and to get this phone
So I could text you
How do I know you’re telling the truth?
Maybe you’re the one I shouldn’t be trusting
Lucy, stop
You know me
You’ve known me since kindergarten
We went to college together
We roomed together, as soon as they lifted those stupid co-ed rules.
Maybe you’ve changed
I haven’t.
Look, Lucy.
I know you’re only saying this because you’re scared.
But you know that you can trust me
What? Were you going to say something?
Yeah, hold on. Let me type it all out.
Remember that time in third grade, when Michael Lewis pushed me off the monkey bars?
Yeah
Well, you’re the one who got me up
You were a puny little third grader, but you carried me--literally carried me--to the nurse’s office, even though the playground monitors tried to stop you
But before you picked me up, do you remember what you did?
Yeah
I punched Michael Lewis in the face
Broke his stupid nose.
Damn straight
I could NEVER betray someone who did that for me
You know that about me.
Yeah, I do.
And Brendan did say something especially weird
He asked if YOU put me up to ignoring him
It was like he knew you were alive.
See?!
Ugh, I’m so sorry. I literally thought you were dead…
Found out you were alive…
And then flipped on you in a second.
I’m a terrible person.
You’re not a terrible person--you’re human
See that right there? How you’re forgiving me like that?
That just makes me feel worse.
Let it go
We don’t have time for you to feel bad
Yeah--But wait, did you seriously kill someone?!
Yeah. Lucy, it was intense
I start shaking just thinking about it.
But I’ll tell you quick--
There was a guard in front of my cell
And by some twist of luck, I was able to unscrew the lead bar from my window without him hearing me…
And then I pretended I had to go to the bathroom…
And I clocked him over the head with it
Oh god, it was terrible.
There was blood everywhere.
Oh my God!
I can’t believe you did that
Me neither. I can’t think about it
I need to compartmentalize it right now
To stop the shaking.
Yeah, I get that.
I didn’t know how much time I had
So I quickly I grabbed the keys and cellphone off his body
And texted you.
Thank god I know your cellphone number by heart
Seriously
Lucy?
I was thinking about this when you were texting Brendan.
I’ve come up with a way to get us out of here. Listen up…
